intro: Thalictrum microspermum var. sikokianum, commonly known as the Sikokian meadow rue, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with its stems often covered in soft, hairy pubescence. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species in woodland gardens.
